Description.div:
Required. Contains the details of an order. There is no required attribute to create an order. Certain attributes are defaulted by the system during createOrder. OrderNo is generated when not passed, DocumentType is set to '0001' and EnterpriseCode is defaulted to 'DEFAULT' if not passed. EnterpriseCode, DocumentType and OrderNo attributes identify the Order. These attributes cannot be modified later on and must be passed if default values are not acceptable. Order needs to have following information before it is confirmed or if order is created with DraftOrderFlag as 'N'.
-At least one order line
-PersonInfoBillTo

Identifies the scheduling rule used by the Schedule API or time-triggered transaction.
Default: SYSTEM rule is used.
Must be a valid AllocationRuleId for the Enterprise's RuleSet, in the table YFS_ALLOCATION_RULE.

If ApplyOnlyItemLevelPricingRules is passed as Y then pricing rules that are applicable at the item level will be run.
Pricing rules with IsItemRule value as 'Y' are executed.
Passed coupons with IsItemRule value as 'Y' are executed.
Order total pricing rules are suppressed.
Shipping charge calculation, shipping rules execution and shipping coupon execution are suppressed.
Default value is N .

Optional. AuditTransactionID is a user defined data. If this field is passed to the API it is not persisted in DB but passed on to orderReprice user exit so that any special pricing if needed can be considered.

Date on which order will automatically cancelled. If not provided, it is defaulted as null date during order creation. If provided, the order monitor agent is will cancel the orders automatically after this Date.

The identifier of the bill to customer. If a customer definition representing the buyer organization exists within the system, the BillToID can represent the CustomerID of the customer. Otherwise, the BillToID can represent the PersonID of the bill to address or the BuyerOrganizationCode of the buyer organization.
BillToID has an aggregate status of inactive.

Identifies the buying organization. The value must be a valid organization defined in the system.
If the BuyerOrganizationCode is not passed and the rule in the YFS_ORDER_VALIDATION table for BuyerValidation is either 01 -Same as Enterprise or 00 -None, the BuyerOrganizationCode defaults to the EnterpriseCode for the order.
Must be a valid organization in the YFS_ORGANIZATION table.
BuyerOrganizationCode must conform to the rule setup in YFS_ORDER_VALIDATION table.

This is the User Id of the customer for which order is created. This field maps to User_Id field of YFS_Customer_Contact. If BuyerUserId is passed, then the customer contact is looked up in the customer hierarchy.
BuyerUserId has an aggregate status of inactive.

Optional. This flag indicates whether processing for pricing should be performed.
Default: N
If set to Y , processing for pricing will not be performed. It is assumed that pricing information is provided in the input to the api.
The carrier service used to ship for the order. For example, a carrier service might be Next Day Air.

Indicates if actual freight charges should be passed on to the customer.
Default: N
If set to Y , invoicing picks up charges from the actual shipment and uses that to invoice the customer. If this is set to Y shipping charges are expected to be give during the actual shipment, not during creating the order.

This is the customer contact ID for the order. This field maps to contact ID field of YFS_Customer_Contact. If both BuyerUserId and CustomerContactID are passed, then both the fields must map to a unique customer contact. If CustomerContactID is passed, the customer contact is looked up only for the customer and not in the entire customer hierarchy.
CustomerContactID is invalid.
First name of the customer placing the order.
Last name of the customer placing the order.
Daytime Phone number of the customer placing the order.
Address Zip Code of the customer placing the order.

Indicates if the billing, shiping, payment, tax, and currency information on the order should be defaulted from the customer information. When the flag is set to "Y", and a valid customer is found, the billing, shipping, and tax information on the order will be defaulted either from the customer or from the customer contact. The payment method on the order will only be defaulted if there is no payment method on the order. The currency will only be defaulted if the customer's IsDefaultCurrency is set to 'Y'.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Indicates what organization will pay the freight charges. If predefined values such as SUPPLIER, ENTERPRISE and MARKETPLACE are used, then the organization specified will pay for the freight. Other values can be passed. The value passed must be a valid shipment charge type, as understood by the carrier, and by which the shipment is transported. See YFS_SHIPMENT_CONTAINER.carrier_payment_type for additional information.

The document type used to describe the order. Part of the unique key for the order.
Default: 0001 - Sales Order.
Some examples are Sales Order document, Planned Order document, Return Order document, or Purchase Order document. The value of DocumentType determines the order's fulfillment cycle and controls the inventory and payment updates performed on the order. Since the DocumentType determines how processing occurs, it is important to supply the correct DocumentType for the order.

Flag describing if the order is waiting to be confirmed. DraftOrderFlag is not applicable to Quote document type. The Quote is always created with DraftOrderFlag=Y.
Default: N
Order lines can be deleted from the system only when they are in the draft stage. The order lines can be deleted using the ChangeOrder API, with the Action attribute set to REMOVE .
When a draft order is created the following entities are optional: OrderLine, PersonInfoBillTo, PersonInfoShipTo, and PaymentMethod.
A draft order is always created with a PaymentStatus of NOT_APPLICABLE if payment processing is not enabled for draft orders. .

Code to identify to which organization the order belongs.
Default: DEFAULT
Must be an existing EnterpriseCode in the YFS_ENTERPRISE table.

The channel through which this order was created. If the value of EntryType on the order matches the value of the common code Entry_Type, the common code's attributes are considered during order validation.

Conditional. Identifies the exchange type of the order. The payment processing logic is dependent on this attribute. Valid values are: REGULAR, ADVANCED_PP, ADVANCED. If OrderPurpose is passed, ReturnOrderHeaderKeyForExchange and ExchangeType are required.
Mandatory for exchange order.
Either ExchangeType,OrderPurpose,Return_OH_Key_For_Exchange not passed.
ExchangeType should be defined in common code.

This attribute is deprecated as of Sterling Supply Chain Applications 7.1. If you want to use deprecated functionality, set the rule 'Use deprecated hold Functionality'. If it is used in deprecated mode, HoldFlag will indicate if order is on hold. If order is on hold, default configuration will stop the shceduling and release process for the order. If the rule is not set, this flag is set/reset by the application. Application sets HoldFlag to 'Y' if order has any hold types or any order line has any hold. Flag is reset to 'N' if there are no hold types on order and on order lines. In this mode based on hold type configuration, certain transactions may not be allowed to process. This flag should not be passed when rule is configured to use 7.1 functionality. There are no validations for this but value can be reset by the application based on hold types on order.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Part of the unique key for the order. EnterpriseCode, DocumentType and OrderNo together uniquely identify an order. OrderNo can be passed to createOrder API, or can be generated by the system.
If an OrderNo is not passed, the user exit getOrderNo is called. If the getOrderNo user exit is not implemented, the application generates an OrderNo. Order numbers generated by the system are prefixed with 'Y'.

Optional. This indicates specific purpose this order is created for. For Exchange Orders, valid value is EXCHANGE. If OrderPurpose is EXCHANGE, then ReturnOrderHeaderKeyForExchange and ExchangeType must be specified. The system may create an order with OrderPurpose of REFUND for internal use.
Either ExchangeType,OrderPurpose,Return_OH_Key_For_Exchange not passed.

Identifies the payment rule associated with this order. If the PaymentRuleID is passed, all decisions on payment handling are controlled by this rule.
Default: If no PaymentRuleID is passed, the PaymentRuleID defaults to the PaymentRuleID setup by the seller organization.
PaymentRuleID not valid

Value for the payment status. The correct value is dependent on a number of conditions.
If no PaymentStatus is passed, the PaymentStatus value is set based on the following logic:
Condition
PaymentStatus set to
The DraftOrderFlag is Y
NOT_APPLICABLE
The document type of the order does not require payment update.
NOT_APPLICABLE
The seller organization does not require payment processing.
NOT_APPLICABLE
Any of the PaymentMethods is incomplete. PaymentMethods that are suspended are not considered.
AWAIT_PAY_INFO
Any of the PaymentMethods is suspended.
AWAIT_AUTH
The total amount of the Order is greater than zero.
AWAIT_AUTH
The PaymentStatus must be valid. Use the getPaymentStatusList API to get all the valid values.
If default processing would generate a PaymentStatus of NOT_APPLICABLE (see table above), a PaymentStatus cannot be provided.

Identifies a price program to apply to this order.
The PriceProgramName must exist for the SellerOrganizationCode in the table YFS_PRICE_PROGRAM.

Attribute.Name: ProcessPaymentOnReturnOrder
Attribute.Description: Indicates that payment methods should be copied onto the return order and that refunds should be processed there, as opposed to the original sales order. This is only valid for return orders. ReturnByGiftRecipient attribute should not be combined with ProcessPaymentOnReturnOrder="Y", if used togeather ReturnByGiftRecipient takes higher precedence.

Description.div: Flag to indicate if an attempt should be made to reserve inventory for product lines during order creation.

Optional. Flag used by return orders to indicate if the return is initiated by the gift recipient. If ReturnByGiftRecipient is 'N', then payment methods will NOT be copied from the original sales orders to the return order; instead refunds will be processed on the sales orders. ReturnByGiftRecipient attribute should not be combined with ProcessPaymentOnReturnOrder="Y", if used togeather ReturnByGiftRecipient takes higher precedence.
If flag is passed 'Y' for non-return document.
All the lines of this return should be for the same ShipTo address.

Conditional. Identifies the return order header key for which this exchange order is getting created. If OrderPurpose is passed, ReturnOrderHeaderKeyForExchange and ExchangeType are required.
Mandatory for exchange order.
A return order should exist for the passed key.
No other exchange order should exist for this key.
Either ExchangeType,OrderPurpose,Return_OH_Key_For_Exchange not passed.

Value of SCAC and Service code.
If ScacAndService or ScacAndServiceKey is passed, the values of SCAC and CarrierServiceCode are overriden based on the corresponding values in the YFS_SCAC_AND_SERVICE table.
Must be an existing ScacAndService code in the table YFS_SCAC_AND_SERVICE.

Identifies the selling organization.
If the SellerOrganizationCode is not passed and the rule in YFS_ORDER_VALIDATION for SellerValidation is set to either 01 - Same as Enterprise or 00 - None, the SellerOrganizationCode defaults to the EnterpriseCode of the order.
Must be an existing organization in the table YFS_ORGANIZATION.
SellerOrganizationCode must conform to the rule setup in YFS_ORDER_VALIDATION table.
Determines whether BOM XML specific validations should be skipped. Default: N

Attribute.Name: SourcingClassification
Attribute.Description: This attribute will be used to determine node for sourcing.

Description.div:
Flag to indicate if com.yantra.ypm.japi.ue.YPMValidateExternalPromotionsUE userexit should be invoked if implemented to validate external promotions.
Valid Values: Y or N
Default: N

Indicates if item needs to be validated against catalog. It overrides configuration rule for validating the item if passed non-blank. Must be set to Y to apply entitlement logic.
Valid Values: Y or N

Indicates if promotions and awards need to be validated and matched.
Valid Values: Y or N
Default: Y

Optional. Stores order line information, including item details and shipping information. Multiple OrderLines can be created for a single order. At least one OrderLine must exist for an order if order is getting created with DraftOrderFlag as 'N'. For draft order, line must be added before confirming the order.
No OrderLine passed.
Line is a bundle parent and child lines are automatically created based on the components of the bundle in the catalog, which contains a model item.
The BOM XML to be used to create the order line and its components.

Describes how product is delivered. DeliveryMethod is only valid for product lines.
Valid Values: DEL - Delivery, SHP -Ship, CARRY - Cash And Carry or PICK - Pickup by the user.
Orderlines having Cash And Carry delivery method are ignored while scheduling the order.
If a DeliveryMethod value is not passed, the value is set as follows:
If the ProductLine has Delivery associations, set to DEL .
If the Item's DefaultDeliveryMethod has a value of Y
in the catalog, then the Item is checked for shipping methods, as defined by the following fields in the Catalog:
Condition
DeliveryMethod value
IS_SHIPPING_ALLLOWED is Y
SHP
IS_DELIVERY_ALLLOWED is Y
DEL
IS_PICKUP_ALLLOWED is Y
PICK
If a value is passed, it must be a valid value.
This field can be used for line classification and reporting purposes. If department code is passed at order header but not passed at order line then value at order header is pushed to order line.

Indicates how the OrderLines are dependent on the parent line. The DependencyShippingRule can only be specified for the parent line.
If DependencyShippingRule is specified on the parent line, it is defaulted to the same value on all the dependent lines. If DependencyShippingRule is passed on any of the dependent lines, the value passed is ignored.
Default: " " (Null)
Valid values: 01 - Ship together, 02 - Deliver together
If DependencyShippingRule value is 02 , a MergeNode must be specified. Order release created for these lines have a MergeNode value, so shipments are first made to the MergeNode, where they are consolidated for final shipment.
The DependencyShippingRule can only be specified for a product line (ItemGroupCode value is PROD ). A product line associated with a delivery line cannot be a part of any dependency shipping rule.
If DependencyShippingRule is passed for delivery or provided service line or an associated product line.
If MergeNode is not specified for parent line, and DependencyShippingRule value is 02 .
Invalid value is passed.
Based on the DependencyShippingRule, some of attributes on dependent lines are defaulted from the parent line. For these attributes have any value other than what parent line has, the value is ignored. In addition to following attributes EarliestShipDate and EarliestDeliveryDate are also copied from parent line to dependent line.
Value
ShippingRule
ShipNode
ReceivingNode
ShipTo
MergeNode
ReqShipDate
ReqDeliveryDate
01 defaults defaults - - - defaults defaults
02 defaults - defaults defaults defaults defaults defaults

When the flag is set to Y, bundle parent does not explode into components during createOrder api invocation. This attribute was introduced for a specific customer usecase.Order fulfillment for bundles will have an impact when set to Y, without a valid usecase.

If passed then supplies and demands are read applying the distribution rule filter for inventory availability.
Must be a valid DistributionRuleID for the seller organization passed.

The minimum quantity of the OrderedQty that must be fulfilled in a single release.
Default: 0
Any positive number not greater than line ordered quantity.
If invalid number is passed

This flag indicates whether the order line should be backordered upon creation. If passed as 'Y', the line will be backordered even if inventory is available. If a reservation ID is passed on the order line and reservation exists for a current, past or future date, reservation will be consumed to block inventory for the backordered demand. In this scenario, demand created by the reservation ID is removed, and a backordered demand will be generated. No attempt is made to look for inventory if reservation is not available for the passed reservation ID. For draft orders, the reservation is consumed and the order line is created in created status. During confirmDraftOrder, this line goes in backordered status. This flag is ignored if reservation is mandatory. This flag should not be passed for bundle parent lines. If it is passed as 'Y' for bundle parent order line, the line is created in backorder status. It is not propagated to bundle components.

Indicates if the pre-defined node on the line is firm or not. If IsFirmPredefinedNode is marked as N, then the node on the line is ignored during scheduling. If not passed, the default value for this Flag is Y. If ProcureFromNode is passed, this flag will always be set to Y. For a DS or a PS line so, it is defaulted to Y. If the ship node is not present on the line but the value passed is Y, then it is treated as N during scheduling.

Specifies whether the OrderLine is a product, delivery, or provided service Line.
Default: PROD - Product
Valid Values: PROD , DS or PS .
If the ItemGroupCode is not passed, the Item is looked up in the catalog or is assigned during the user exit YCMGetItemDetailsUE. If the Item is not found, the ItemGroupCode is defaulted to PROD .
If the value is passed, it must be a valid value.
When service item which exists in the catalog is passed for bundle parent line.
When DS item is passed as component for a bundle.

Specifies a collection of items that form a unit. For example, a home theater system is a unit, or kit, consisting of components such as a VCR, a TV, a stereo, and other components.
Valid values: LK - Logical kit, PK - Physical kit, DPK - Dynamic Physical kit, BUNDLE - Bundle
If no KitCode is passed, the createOrder API searches the item in the Catalog. The following are the possible scenarios. See Validation Conditions for possible error scenarios.
Kit definition passed
Item in catalog
KitItem
Orderline based on
Y Y Y Passed KitDefinition
N Y Y Catalog definition
Kit definition not passed, item exists in the catalog, it is a kit item, but there is no kit definition.
Kit definition not passed, item does not exist in the catalog.
Kit definition passed as the KitLines element, and the Item is not in catalog.
Kit definition passed as the KitLines element, and the Item is not a KitItem.
Bundle parent line can not have a logical kit component.
Bundle parent line can not have a dynamic physical kit component.

If two or more OrderLines are to be delivered together, this is the node where these lines are merged before final delivery. This field is required when the DependencyShippingRule is set to 02 .
Must exist in table YFS_SHIP_NODE.

The preferred minimum ship by date of the available supply that order line can allocate against. Available supply with ship by date earlier than the minimum ship by date will not be considered. This applies to the order line with a valid time-sensitive item. The MinShipByDate of the order line will also be used by all kit lines with valid time-sensitive item.

The quantity of the line item that is being ordered. This quantity is in Inventory UnitOfMeasure. If Quantity needs to be passed in a different UnitOfMeasure (only allowed for a Product line), then it should be passed in OrderLineTranQuantity node.
For a service line item which is used as a standalone service, OrderedQty is treated in the same manner as product lines and must be a non-zero positive number.
The OrderedQty value passed on the service line is ignored, if ordered quantity computaion is not based on entered quantity.
Any non-zero positive number for a product Line or standalone service line.
If SerialNo is provided and OrderedQty is not equal to one.

Pipeline id on order line. If not passed, system will determine the pipeline based on attributes on the line.
It should be a valid pipeline for the process type order line belongs.

The order line number. Part of an OrderLine's unique key. If PrimeLineNo is not passed, it is generated. A starting number can be specified in the configurator at each document type and enterprise level. If a starting number is specified the PrimeLineNo will be generated starting from that number.

The node from which the order line should be procured if cannot source from the shipnode on the order line.
ProcureFromNode can be specified only if shipnode is passed.
If Reservation is attempted from ProcureFromNode, then shipnode must have Procure To Ship Allowed Flag set to Y

The date and time when the appointment ends for an OrderLine.This date only applies to Provided (ItemGroupCode=PS) and Delivered (ItemGroupCode=DS) lines.
PromisedApptEndDate must be greater than or equal to PromisedApptStartDate.
If PromisedApptEndDate is passed, but PromisedApptStartDate is not passed.
If the date corresponds to a slot which cannot be used for appointment planning.

The date and time when the appointment starts for an OrderLine. This date only applies to Provided (ItemGroupCode=PS) and Delivered (ItemGroupCode=DS) lines.
PromisedApptStartDate cannot be after PromisedApptEndDate.
If PromisedApptStartDate is passed, but PromisedApptEndDate is not passed.
If the date corresponds to a slot which cannot be used for appointment planning.

The node to which an OrderLine is to be shipped.
Note: When calling this API for a return order, this ReceivingNode attribute should contain the receiving_node ID associated with the "Ship From" node (the node from which the returned item is shipped).
Must exist in table YFS_SHIP_NODE.

This flag indicates whether this line can be created without a reservation. If set to Y, creation of this line or any quantity addition to this line will be allowed only if the quantity can be reserved. If a ProcureFromNode is also present on the line, then the reservation will be carried out on the procure from node. This flag is not supported by bundle parent. It is ignored by bundle parent order lines. It is not propagated to bundle components.

Value of SCAC and Service code.
If ScacAndService or ScacAndServiceKey is passed, the values of SCAC and CarrierServiceCode are overriden based on the corresponding values in the YFS_SCAC_AND_SERVICE table.
Must be an existing ScacAndService code in the table YFS_SCAC_AND_SERVICE.
Indicates Segment for the order line. For a Made To Customer order, the value is defaulted to BuyerOrganizationCode. For a Made To Order Order, the value is defaulted to OrderLineKey.

Indicates SegmentType for the order line. For a Made to Customer Order, the value is MTC. For a Dynamic Physical Kit item which is Made To Order, SegmentType is MTO. For an MTC order, Inventory Tag passed at line level is used. Inventory Tags passed at schedule level are not used for creation of work orders.
If passed as MTC, the following validations are done:
a) Buyer Organization must have Requires_Vas_Compliance flag set to Y
b) Buyer Organization must have have Inbound Vas Compliance setup for the item passed in Order Line.
c) The Service item selected must have Involves_Segment_Change flag set to Y.
If SegmentType is MTC, Buyer Organization must have VAS Compliance setup as specified above.
If passed as MTO, the following validations are done:
a) The KitCode passed must be DPK.
b) The kit components must be passed.
If SegmentType is MTO, the KitCode passed must be DPK
If SegmentType is MTO, the kit components must be passed.

Requested serial number of the item.
If SerialNo is provided and OrderedQty is not equal to one.
If SerialNo is provided but ShipNode is not.

Ship node from which the order line will be fulfilled.
Note: When calling this API for a return order, this ShipNode attribute should contain the shipnode_key associated with the "Return To" node (the node to which the returned item is being sent).
Must exist in table YFS_SHIP_NODE
If SerialNo is provided, ShipNode is mandatory
If ShipNode is provided and ReservationID is provided to represent a capacity reservation for the service line and ShipNode is not the same as the node of the resource pool on the reservation.
Times from the database are converted into the timezone specified by this field by the UI. Used with order lines with an ItemGroupCode of PS - Provided Service or DS - Delivery Service.

TransactionalLineId used to identify a line when creating associations of this line with other lines. This TransactionalLineId is not stored in the database and cannot be used after an order has been created. See ProductServiceAssoc entity for more information.
Must be unique for the createOrder transaction.

Indicates if item needs to be validated against catalog. It overrides configuration rule for validating the item if passed non-blank. When set to "N", this order line will not be considered for min/max ordered quantity validation. Must be set to Y to apply entitlement logic.
Default: Null
Valid Values: Y or N

Awards that are created out of the promotions. A single promotion can result in to multiple awards. AwardId must be passed to identify the award.
PromotionId must be passed and it must be a valid one to add the award

Action to perform on this Award.
Default: Null - if not passed awards will be added if not exist or modified.
Valid Values:
REMOVE - Removes the award.

Operation to perform
Valid Values:
Manage - Creates a new record if it does not exist, or modifies an existing record if it does.
Create - Creates a new record.
Modify - Change values in an existing record.
Delete - Deletes an existing record.
The default behavior is Manage .
Determines whether all Promotions, except those listed below, should be removed.
Promotions that are associated to an order or any of its lines. PromotionId must be passed to identify the promotion.

Action to perform on this promotion.
Default: Null - if not passed, promotion will be added if it doesn't exist or modified if it does exist.
Valid Values:
CREATE - Add the specified promotion to the order.
REMOVE - Removes the specified promotion from the order.
If an award record is associated with this promotion, it may not be removed.
If a promotion already exists, can't add the same promotion twice.
For Coupon promotions, the overridden maximum adjustment value for the coupon pricing rule.
For Coupon promotions, if 'Y" the references will be validated and only valid references will be used

Awards that are created out of the promotions. A single promotion can result in to multiple awards. AwardId must be passed to identify the award.
PromotionId must be passed and it must be a valid one to add the award

Action to perform on this Award.
Default: Null - if not passed awards will be added if not exist or modified.
Valid Values:
REMOVE - Removes the award.

ProductServiceAssoc contains the ProductLine and ServiceLine elements which identify the Product and Service line being associated. Both ProductLine and ServiceLine elements must be passed to uniquely identify the lines. If multiple associations need to be made, multiple ProductServiceAssoc nodes should be passed. For a bundle, either associate bundle parent or bundle components with service line not both. Refer to ProductLine and ServiceLine elements for further details.

Specifies the product and service lines being associated. When a new association is created by passing the ProductServiceAssoc, a number of validations are performed.
Only a delivery or provided service OrderLine can be associated with a product OrderLine
A delivery OrderLineor a service OrderLine which is not standalone must be associated with a product OrderLine.
One product OrderLine cannot be associated with more than one delivery OrderLine.
The ItemIDs or product line and service line must have an association present.
A stand-alone provided service OrderLine can not associated with any product OrderLine.
If multiple product OrderLines are associated with one delivery OrderLine, there must be consistent information related to delivery. If the Delivery line does not have values for the following attributes in OrderLine element : PersonInfoShipTo, ReqShipDate, ReqDeliveryDate, MergeNode, ReceivingNode, ShipNode
the product OrderLines associated must not have differing values for any of those elements and attributes. e.g. If a Delivery line is attached to two different product lines and if ReqShipDate is not present on Delivery line , then if the product lines have different values for ReqShipDate, an error will be thrown by the api.
If the delivery OrderLine has any of these attributes present, the value is copied to all associated product OrderLines, even if different values already exist for the Product OrderLines. If Product line has these values but Delivery does not have these values, then these values are copied over to Delivery orderline also. EarliestShipDate and EarliestDeliveryDate are computed by the api and are also synched between Delivery and Product OrderLines.

Primary key generated by the system. May be passed to identify the OrderLine. Alternatively, the TransactionalLineId or
the PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo can be passed.
OrderLineKey must identify an existing OrderLine.

The order line number. Must be passed with the SubLineNo to identify the OrderLine. Alternatively, the TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey can be passed.
Must pass one of the following:
the PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo
or TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey.

Must be passed with the PrimeLineNo to identify the OrderLine. Alternatively, the TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey can be passed.
Must pass one of the following:
the PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo
or TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey.

A virtual field meant to identify order lines when PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo are not passed. Used in Line Associations. This value is not stored in the database. While creating a new line and associating it with another line, the same attribute must be passed in the OrderLine element and in this element to uniquely identify a line if OrderLineKey or PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo are not present.
Must pass one of the following:
the PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo
or TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey.

Primary key generated by the system.
OrderLineKey must identify an existing OrderLine.

The order line number. Part of an order line's unique key.
Must pass one of the following :
The PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo or OrderLineKey or TransactionalLineId.

Part of unique key of line.
Must pass one of the following :
The PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo or OrderLineKey or TransactionalLineId.

A virtual field meant to identify order lines when PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo are not passed. Used in Line Associations. This value is not stored in the database. While creating a new line and associating it with another line, the same attribute must be passed in the OrderLine element as well in this element to uniquely identify a line if OrderLineKey or PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo are not present.
Must pass one of the following :
The PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo or OrderLineKey or TransactionalLineId.

OrderLineRelationship contains the ParentLine and ChildLine elements which identify the Parent and Child line. Both ParentLine and ChildLine elements must be passed to uniquely identify the lines. If multiple OrderLineRelationships need to be made, multiple OrderLineRelationship nodes should be passed. Refer to ParentLine and ChildLine elements for further details.
If circular dependency is detected for order lines of the same RelationshipType. The following error is displayed.
The type of relationship between the parent and the child line. There is no validation for the RelationshipType attribute.

Specifies the parent and the child line being related. When a new relationship is created by passing the OrderLineRelationship the following validation is performed.
If either the parent line or the child line is not passed with the appropriate line identifiers the following error is displayed.

Primary key generated by the system. May be passed to identify the OrderLine. Alternatively, the TransactionalLineId or
the PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo can be passed.
OrderLineKey must identify an existing OrderLine.

The order line number. Must be passed with the SubLineNo to identify the OrderLine. Alternatively, the TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey can be passed.
Must pass one of the following:
the PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo
or TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey.

Must be passed with the PrimeLineNo to identify the OrderLine. Alternatively, the TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey can be passed.
Must pass one of the following:
the PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo
or TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey.

A virtual field meant to identify order lines when PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo are not passed. Used in Line Associations. This value is not stored in the database. While creating a new line and associating it with another line, the same attribute must be passed in the OrderLine element and in this element to uniquely identify a line if OrderLineKey or PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo are not present.
Must pass one of the following:
the PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo
or TransactionalLineId or the OrderLineKey.

Primary key generated by the system.
OrderLineKey must identify an existing OrderLine.

The order line number. Part of an order line's unique key.
Must pass one of the following :
The PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo or OrderLineKey or TransactionalLineId.

Part of unique key of line.
Must pass one of the following :
The PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo or OrderLineKey or TransactionalLineId.

A virtual field meant to identify order lines when PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo are not passed. Used in Line Associations. This value is not stored in the database. While creating a new line and associating it with another line, the same attribute must be passed in the OrderLine element as well in this element to uniquely identify a line if OrderLineKey or PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo are not present.
Must pass one of the following :
The PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo or OrderLineKey or TransactionalLineId.

The currency code in which this order is being processed. All price fields are assumed to be in this currency.
Default: Currency that is the default for the Enterprise.
Must be valid currency for the Enterprise's ruleset, in the table YFS_CURRENCY.

If the EnterpriseCurrency value is not passed, the Enterprise's locale is used to get a currency for that locale. The currency for the locale is validated for the Enterprise's ruleset. If no errors occur during lookup and validation, the EnterpriseCurrency is defaulted to the currency for that locale.
If the EnterpriseCurrency value is passed, or is calculated based on enterprise locale, it must be a valid currency for the Enterprise's ruleset, in the table YFS_CURRENCY.
If the EnterpriseCurrency value is not passed, and the Enterprise's locale is invalid
If the EnterpriseCurrency value is not passed, and no locale is set for the Enterprise's ruleset.

The conversion rate from the order's original currency to the Enterprise's currency. This is not used internally within the system. This field is provided so that reports can be built in a standard currency for an Enterprise.
If default reporting converstion Rate flag is checked in currency definition setup, ReportingConversionRate value passed in i/p xml will be ignored and the value would be based on currency conversion setup.

The charge category. For example, Labeling or Handling.
The validation is done only when the ValidateChargeNameandCategory rule is set to Yes . The same combination of ChargeCategory and ChargeName must not be passed multiple times for a given order.
The same combination of ChargeCategory and ChargeName is passed multiple item for the same order.
The ChargeCategory is not passed.
Either of the ChargeCategory and ChargeName are not a valid combination for the document, or for the ruleset of the Enterprise. The table YFS_CHARGE_NAME is used as part of this check.
Contains tax related information for various entities in the system. If ChargeCategory and ChargeName are not provided, tax will be considered as a billable and positive charge.

The tax amount. Tax cannot be less than zero.
Negative amount is passed.

Type of tax. The TaxName must only be passed once, even when using a combination of ChargeCategory and ChargeName.
Must be provided if HeaderTaxes is passed.
If a combination of ChargeCategory and ChargeName is used, and TaxName is passed multiple times.
Value associated with the Reference Name.

PaymentMethod can be added, modified or removed .
If payment processing is not required for the order, any payment method passed in the input xml is still subject to validations.
Only the PaymentMethod attributes specified in the input xml can be changed. Attempting to change other attributes on PaymentMethod , such as TotalAuthorized or TotalCharged results in an error.
Pass changed value for attributes not specfied in input xml.

Used to identify the order to which charges are applied.
The Seller Organization can configure the payment types so that they are charged and refunded in a particular sequence. The charge sequence and refund sequence are independent of each other. A PaymentType with a ChargeSequence set to
0
is charged before another PaymentType with ChargeSequence set to
1
.
The Buyer can also specify the ChargeSequence of the PaymentMethod in the createOrder input xml. If a charge sequence is not specified by the Buyer, the Seller's ChargeSequence is followed.
If both the Buyer and the Seller supply ChargeSequence , charges are made in the order that the Seller specifies, but within a particular charge type, such as CreditCard, the Buyer's sequence is honored.
For example:
A seller specifies the ChargeSequence as 0 for CUSTOMER_ACCOUNT, 1 for CREDIT_CARD, 2 for OTHER.
A buyer specifies the ChargeSequence as 1 for MyBank-CreditCard, 2 for CUSTOMER_ACCOUNT, and 3 for MyOther-CreditCard.
The payment methods are charged in the following sequence:
CUSTOMER_ACCOUNT, MyBank-CreditCard, MyOther-CreditCard.
The Customer account is charged because that is the seller's preferred method, and the two credit cards are charged based on the order that the buyer specified.
The Entry Type used to enter payment information into the system.

Type of payment.
The PaymentType must be a value that is already configured for the Seller Organization.
If a PaymentMethod element is passed, the PaymentType is validated, even if payment processing is not required for the order.
Must be a value defined for the Seller Organization.
PaymentType must be passed.

Indicates if external charges are being recorded for an asynchronous request. Valid values are 'Y', 'N' or Void. Set this flag to "Y" with a valid RequestAmount to indicate that the external charges are being recorded for an asynchronous request. This will enable the system to adjust the pending asynchronous amounts correctly. Set the flag to "N" to indicate that the external charges are being recorded for non-asynchronous request. In this mode, system will not process any pending asynchronous amounts. Set this flag to Void or Do not pass this flag, if unsure the request is asynchronous or not. In this mode system will try to adjust any pending asynchronous amounts that exists for the request. This mode is provided for backward compatibility.

Description.p: This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

Description.div: This field is used as an Identifier for recording a response for transaction closed as asynchronous. Pass AsyncRequestIdentifier only when ReducePendingAsyncronousAmounts flag is set to "Y". AsyncRequestIdentifier will be ignored if ReducePendingAsyncronousAmounts flag is passed as "N". Use AsyncRequestIdentifier as an identifier to record the response of a asynchronous transaction only once. AsyncRequestIdentifier can be associated to a asynchronously closed transaction in the user exit.

Description.p: AuditTransactionID is a user defined data. This data will be stored on YFS_ORDER_AUDIT table. Also in case of APIs that cause the creation of a CHARGE_REQUEST, the same field will be stored on YFS_CHARGE_TRANSACTION table.

The type of charge that is being applied to the order.
Valid Values: AUTHORIZATION or CHARGE . Invalid value is passed.
The date and time when the charge is realized.It can be future date.When this date is passed in input xml, Is_Collection_Date_Firm flag is set to Y.

This flag indicates whether or not pre-authorized or pre-charged amounts for the entire order will be held until the order is completely invoiced. If passed as 'Y', they will be. If passed as 'N', or not passed, the extra charge or authorization amount is not held. For example, if there are two units of $5 each on an pre-paid order, and $10 are collected up front, then when HoldAgainstBook is passed as 'N', a refund for $5 is created upon invoicing of the first unit. When passed as 'Y', no refund is created. If the pre-charged amount is $12 for the order, and when HoldAgainstBook is passed as 'N', a refund is created for $7 upon invoicing of the first unit, and for $2 when HoldAgainstBook is passed as 'Y'.

This flag indicates that the transaction represents an in person, or card in hand, transaction. A transaction that is in person will distribute against in person order totals and invoices, and vice versa.

This flag indicates the transaction attempted to reach the payment gateway but was unable to contact it. This should only be passed for unprocessed records, as this may be updated to N by the user exit, and will be reset to null when the record moves to CLOSED status.

The EntryType used to enter payment information into the system, such as by a magnetic card reader. If passed, this attribute will take precedence over other attributes for the entry type of the transaction.

If ProcessedAmount is passed as a value greater than zero, the STATUS in the CHARGE_TRANSACTION table is set to CLOSED .
If ProcessedAmount is passed as zero or not passed, the STATUS will be set to OPEN, unless RequestProcessed is passed as Y. The ProcessedAmount is used to update CHARGE_TRANSACTION table, depending on the charge type. If the ChargeType value is :
AUTHORIZATION - the OpenAuthorizedAmount is updated with the ProcessedAmount.
CHARGE - the CreditAmount is updated with the ProcessedAmount.
This field can be used to store reason code for transaction update.

For ChargeTypes CHARGE and AUTHORIZATION, this field holds the amount that is requested for charging/authorization. If RequestAmount is passed, it is set as the RequestAmount of the chargetransaction record and the TranAmount of the creditcardtransaction record.

If the value of this is Y , the payment details record will be treated as already processed. This flag is considered only when ProcessedAmount is 0 . Request with ProcessedAmount greater than or less than 0 is always considered as processed.
This element cannot be passed for orders with pending changes.

Description.div: This field is used as an Identifier for recording a response for transaction closed as asynchronous. Pass AsyncRequestIdentifier only when ReducePendingAsyncronousAmounts flag is set to "Y". AsyncRequestIdentifier will be ignored if ReducePendingAsyncronousAmounts flag is passed as "N". Use AsyncRequestIdentifier as an identifier to record the response of a asynchronous transaction only once. AsyncRequestIdentifier can be associated to a asynchronously closed transaction in the user exit.

Description.p: AuditTransactionID is a user defined data. This data will be stored on YFS_ORDER_AUDIT table. Also in case of APIs that cause the creation of a CHARGE_REQUEST, the same field will be stored on YFS_CHARGE_TRANSACTION table.

The type of charge that is being applied to the order.
Valid Values: AUTHORIZATION or CHARGE . Invalid value is passed.
The date and time when the charge is realized.It can be future date.When this date is passed in input xml, Is_Collection_Date_Firm flag is set to Y.

This flag indicates whether or not pre-authorized or pre-charged amounts for the entire order will be held until the order is completely invoiced. If passed as 'Y', they will be. If passed as 'N', or not passed, the extra charge or authorization amount is not held. For example, if there are two units of $5 each on an pre-paid order, and $10 are collected up front, then when HoldAgainstBook is passed as 'N', a refund for $5 is created upon invoicing of the first unit. When passed as 'Y', no refund is created. If the pre-charged amount is $12 for the order, and when HoldAgainstBook is passed as 'N', a refund is created for $7 upon invoicing of the first unit, and for $2 when HoldAgainstBook is passed as 'Y'.

This flag indicates that the transaction represents an in person, or card in hand, transaction. A transaction that is in person will distribute against in person order totals and invoices, and vice versa.

This flag indicates the transaction attempted to reach the payment gateway but was unable to contact it. This should only be passed for unprocessed records, as this may be updated to N by the user exit, and will be reset to null when the record moves to CLOSED status.

The EntryType used to enter payment information into the system, such as by a magnetic card reader. If passed, this attribute will take precedence over other attributes for the entry type of the transaction.

If ProcessedAmount is passed as a value greater than zero, the STATUS in the CHARGE_TRANSACTION table is set to CLOSED .
If ProcessedAmount is passed as zero or not passed, the STATUS will be set to OPEN, unless RequestProcessed is passed as Y. The ProcessedAmount is used to update CHARGE_TRANSACTION table, depending on the charge type. If the ChargeType value is :
AUTHORIZATION - the OpenAuthorizedAmount is updated with the ProcessedAmount.
CHARGE - the CreditAmount is updated with the ProcessedAmount.
This field can be used to store reason code for transaction update.

For ChargeTypes CHARGE and AUTHORIZATION, this field holds the amount that is requested for charging/authorization. If RequestAmount is passed, it is set as the RequestAmount of the chargetransaction record and the TranAmount of the creditcardtransaction record.

If the value of this is Y , the payment details record will be treated as already processed. This flag is considered only when ProcessedAmount is 0 . Request with ProcessedAmount greater than or less than 0 is always considered as processed.

Description.div:
The code identifying the Special Service to be performed on the Order.
SpecialServicesCode must be defined in the configuration
Optional. Stores hold type information. Multiple HoldTypes can be passed for a single order. These hold types will be applied in addition to hold types configured to be applied during create order.

The code identifying the hold type to be applied on Order.
HoldType must be defined in the configuration

Attribute.Name: PersonInfoKey
Attribute.Description: The person info record to store this answer set for.

Description.div:
The question type associated to the defined answer set.
QuestionType not passed.
Invalid QuestionType.

The answer for the question.
AnswerValue passed should be a valid answer for the question it belongs to.

Identifier for the question that this answer is for.
QuestionID should be valid.
Determines whether all Promotions, except those listed below, should be removed.
Promotions that are associated to an order or any of its lines. PromotionId must be passed to identify the promotion.

Action to perform on this promotion.
Default: Null - if not passed, promotion will be added if it doesn't exist or modified if it does exist.
Valid Values:
CREATE - Add the specified promotion to the order.
REMOVE - Removes the specified promotion from the order.
If an award record is associated with this promotion, it may not be removed.
If a promotion already exists, can't add the same promotion twice.
For Coupon promotions, the overridden maximum adjustment value for the coupon pricing rule.
For Coupon promotions, if 'Y" the references will be validated and only valid references will be used

Promotion references associated to the promotion. In case of internal promotions, the promotion references will be automatically associated to the generated awards proportional to the awarded quantity.

Operation to perform
Valid Values:
Delete - Removes the PromotionReference. If Operation is not passed the PromotionReference will be created if it does not exist already.

Awards that are created out of the promotions. A single promotion can result in to multiple awards. AwardId must be passed to identify the award.
PromotionId must be passed and it must be a valid one to add the award

Action to perform on this Award.
Default: Null - if not passed awards will be added if not exist or modified.
Valid Values:
REMOVE - Removes the award.
